div.p: This tool bar is how you get around.

When loading your game, Game Setting Window will be display. This windows allows you to change the name of the game, the map, screen and Display dimension, and along with some advance options such as GUI styling.
Next is the language editor, which allow management of Dialogue text and Code strings in multiple languages.
Initial, you will have two files for both code string and dialogue, 00.txt and en.txt, 00.txt acts as base for other languages and used for 'routines/private_language.inc' for scripting uses.
If you wish to support more that language in your game, use set the 'language.available' to list of languages separated by |. example: en|de|fr
Support of non-english languages is very low, due the developer only knowing English, any help would be appreciated .
Spritesheets are collection of sprites on a image file, which allows for easy management and editing via 3rd party project.
The Spritesheet Editor as 3 modes:
Sheet Creation: Copy and loads any PNG format Image into the game and to quicken sprites creation and sprites are layout into tiles, you can use the quick create feature
Sheet can be remove from the game by removing the file the sprite directory.
Sprite Select Mode: Allows visual section of sprite, double-clicking will bring up the Edit Sprite Dialog

Sprite/Animation Create Mode: After selecting the Sprite Creation mode, you can select a region to be used as the new sprite. If frames of a Animation aligned in vertically or horizontally you can select all of them and in.
